title: Drawing, "Santa Maria Sopra Minerva", 1699–1781
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on heavy cream laid paper
markings: Marks: lily in circle above V (RB '45)
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle; upon the ends of the volutes in the second floor two angels are sitting; upon the couped pediment beside the escutcheon at left, "Faith" (or "Religion") with the tablets of the law and a burning flame upon the head, at right St. Magdalene; above the middle of the central door, upon a console, a lying dog with a burning candle in his mouth.  Commission for the Dominican Order.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Santa Maria Sopra Minerva", 1699–1781.
1699–1781. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash on heavy cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3496.
